body_html:
As a temporary hack add you can add an environmental variable and a symlink to fix the problem. Works for me as on tf master, cuda 9, cudnn 7

Dockerfile example:

ENV     CUDNN_INSTALL_PATH=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/
ENV     CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/

ENV LD_LIBRARY_PATH /usr/local/cuda/lib64:/usr/local/cuda/extras/CUPTI/lib64:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
RUN mkdir -p /usr/local/nvidia/lib64/ \
              && cd /usr/local/nvidia/lib64/ \
              && ln -s /usr/local/cuda/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/stubs/libcuda.so libcuda.so.1 \
              && ldconfig /usr/local/cuda/lib64

body:
As a temporary hack add you can add an environmental variable and a symlink to fix the problem. Works for me as on tf master, cuda 9, cudnn 7

Dockerfile example:
```
ENV     CUDNN_INSTALL_PATH=/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/
ENV     CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH=/usr/local/cuda/

ENV LD_LIBRARY_PATH /usr/local/cuda/lib64:/usr/local/cuda/extras/CUPTI/lib64:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH
RUN mkdir -p /usr/local/nvidia/lib64/ \
              && cd /usr/local/nvidia/lib64/ \
              && ln -s /usr/local/cuda/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/stubs/libcuda.so libcuda.so.1 \
              && ldconfig /usr/local/cuda/lib64
```
